field.name: M0
field.description: Master 0 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 1 (highest) priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 2 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 3 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 4 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 5 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 6 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 7 priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: This master has level 8 (lowest) priority when accessing the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M3

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M4

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M5

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M6

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: Park on master port M7

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: When no master makes a request, the arbiter parks the slave port on the master port defined by the PARK field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: When no master makes a request, the arbiter parks the slave port on the last master to be in control of the slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: When no master makes a request, the slave port is not parked on a master and the arbiter drives all outputs to a constant safe state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Fixed priority

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin (rotating) priority

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The low power mode request has the highest priority for arbitration on this slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The low power mode request has the lowest initial priority for arbitration on this slave port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The slave port's registers are writeable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The slave port's registers are read-only and cannot be written. Attempted writes have no effect on the registers and result in a bus error response

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: No arbitration is allowed during an undefined length burst

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration is allowed at any time during an undefined length burst

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration is allowed after four beats of an undefined length burst

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration is allowed after eight beats of an undefined length burst

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration is allowed after 16 beats of an undefined length burst

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved
